de.javasoft.swing.jytable.renderer
Interface ITableHeaderCell

All Known Implementing Classes:
JYTableHeaderCell, SyntheticaJYTableHeaderUI.SyntheticaProvider.SyntheticaJYTableHeaderCell
public interface ITableHeaderCell

Properties to define the layout and content of a header cell with sort marker.

The header cell has two parts: one is the text/icon as defined by application code. The other is the sort marker, typically a UI-defined icon with optional text to denote sort index. The sort marker is controlled by the ui.

The parts are stacked, either vertically or horizontally. The position of the sort marker is basically defined relative to the client content, that is either above/below or before/after the content. SortMarkerPosition fine-tunes the exact behaviour.

Nested Class Summary
static class ITableHeaderCell.HorizontalDock
          Defines horizontal alignment of sort marker for vertical stacking of client area/sort marker.
static class ITableHeaderCell.HorizontalStretch
          Defines distribution of horizont excess space relative to client area for horizontal stacking of client area/sort marker.
static class ITableHeaderCell.SortMarkerPosition

Returns:
postion and layout constraints for the sort marker

setSortMarkerVisible

void setSortMarkerVisible(boolean visible)
Sets the visibility of the sort marker. If visible, the sort marker is shown at the position and layout constraints as controlled by the current SorMarkerPosition. Otherwise, it's not shown. Implementations must take care of potential layout contraints, though, such that cell with and without sort marker are properly aligned.

Parameters:
visible - the visibility of the sort marker.

isSortMarkerVisible

Returns the visibility of the sort marker.

Returns:
the visibility of the sort marker.
